cyclone.name: BETA
cyclone.current_location: about 305 mi ESE of Corpus Christi, Texas
cyclone.trajectory: slow westward drift turning northwest, gradually approaching the middle Texas coast then moving inland and northeast toward east-Texas/Louisiana
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: central Texas coast near the Matagorda Peninsula–Freeport area

weather_observation.watch_coast: Port Mansfield, TX to Cameron, LA including Sabine Lake and Galveston Bay (storm-surge watch)
weather_observation.warning_coast: Port Aransas, TX to Intracoastal City, LA (tropical-storm warning)
weather_observation.impacted_coast: much of the Texas coast from Port Mansfield through High Island and the southwestern Louisiana coast to Cameron
weather_observation.wind: Potential sustained tropical-storm-force winds (35–45 mph) with gusts near 50 mph possible at Port Arthur beginning late Monday into Tuesday.
weather_observation.storm_surge: 2–4 ft inundation possible along Sabine Lake, Port Arthur waterfront, and adjacent low-lying areas if peak surge coincides with high tide.
weather_observation.rainfall: 3–5 inches with localized totals up to 10 inches likely, bringing flash-flood and minor river-flood risk.
weather_observation.other_hazards: Dangerous surf and rip currents; prolonged period of elevated water levels could impede drainage and port operations.
